comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] This was at the conjunction of York and Clarence Streets and the Bradfield Highway about two hundred meters from St Philip's Church and Church hall. Now sadly lost under the Western Distributor; happily St Philip's remains!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] Thanks for placing this fountain! 

AB

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] To see a shot of the light/fountain in situ have a look at this acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=194208 and this acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=190271 I just hope St Philip's Church got their fair share of the revenue from the advertising between the parklet and the church -- but I rather doubt it JC

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: The building on the left, formerly Lawsons Auctioneers, is still there in Cumberland Street. The North Shore Line (up to the bridge) and the City Circle Line (around to Circular Quay) both run under Cumberland Street immediately infront of this building.
